cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: near the extreme southwest Florida peninsula
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across south-central Florida today, then into the eastern Gulf of Mexico and turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect from the Ochlockonee River to the Okaloosa/Walton County line in the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southern Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, and the northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Brief gusts to tropical-storm force (near 40 mph) possible through midday Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Atlantic side surge not expected to exceed 3 ft; elevated surf and dangerous rip currents likely
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated totals up to 6 inches could produce localized flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado possible over south Florida today
